Name: Blank-adjusted method detect limit
Description: Blank-adjusted method detect limit

Name: Contract Detection Limit
Description: Minimum level of detection acceptable under the contract Statement of Work (SOW). However, laboratory-derived IDLs (adjusted for sample size, dilution and moisture) are used for reporting limits

Name: Contract Quantitation Limit
Description: - Minimum level of reliable quantitation acceptable under the contract Statement of Work (SOW).

Name: Daily detection limit
Description: Daily detection limit

Name: Drinking Water Maximum
Description: Maximum Contaminant Levels (MCLs) is the legal threshold limit on the amount of a substance that is allowed in public water systems under the Safe Drinking Water Act.

Name: Estimated Detection Level
Description: Estimated Detection Level -- Minimum concentration required to produce a specified signal-to-noise (S/N) ratio.

Name: Estimated Quantitation Limit
Description: Lowest concentration that can be reliably achieved within specified limits of precision and accuracy during routine lab operations. EQLs normally are arbitrarily set rather than explicitly determined.

Name: Field Holding Time Limit
Description: Performed in field. Samples are only representative of the area they were taken from for a specific length of time before sample preparation or analysis must begin. This is defined as "holding time.

Name: Instrument Detection Level
Description: Instrument Detection Level(IDL)--Lowest concentration that can be detected by an instrument without correction for the effects of sample matrix or method-specific parameters such as sample preparation

Name: Interim Reporting Level
Description: Interim Reporting Level - a temporary reporting level used for new or custom schedules when a LRL has not yet been established

Name: Laboratory Holding Time Limit
Description: Performed in Lab. Samples are only representative of the area they were taken from for a specific length of time before sample preparation or analysis must begin. This is defined as  "holding time.

Name: Laboratory Reporting Level
Description: Laboratory Reporting Level - formerly referred to as Non-Detection Value

Name: Long Term Method Detection Level
Description: is a modification of the defintion of the method detection limit (MDL). It includes a more thorough capture of laboratory variability, and is calculated using three different possible data assessments

Name: Lower limit of detection
Description: - Generally the same as IDL. IDLs are explicitly determined and generally defined as three times the standard deviation of the mean noise level.

Name: Lower Quantitation Limit
Description: Lower Limit of Quantitation(LLQ) Generally the same as EQL.

Name: Lower Reporting Limit
Description: Lower Reporting Limit

Name: Measurement Uncertainty
Description: A quantitative expression of error that results from incomplete knowledge or information about a parameter or value

Name: Method Detection Level
Description: Synonymous with Method Detection Limit (MDL), is the minimum concentration of a substance that can be measured and reported with a 99% confidence that the analyte concentration is greater than zero.

Name: Minimum Reporting Level
Description: Minimum Reporting Level is the smallest measured concentration of a constituent that can be reliably measured using a given analytical method

Name: Practical Quantitation Limit
Description: Practical Quantitation Limit (PQL)

Name: Reporting limit
Description: Reporting limit

Name: Required detection limit
Description: New term from the Federal Register ... to be investigated

Name: Sample Detection Limit
Description: Sample Detection Limit (SDL) - The MDL adjusted to reflect sample-specific actions such as dilution or use of smaller aliquot sizes, or to report results on a dry-weight basis.

Name: Sample-specific min detect conc
Description: Sample-specific min detect concentration

Name: Sample-Specific Quantitation Limit
Description: - The EQL adjusted to reflect sample-specific actions such as dilution or use of smaller aliquot sizes, or to report results on a dry-weight basis.

Name: Specified in workplan
Description: Specified in workplan... requested by GLENDA

Name: Statistical Uncertainty
Description: That component of uncertainty which arises from imprecision. www.iaea.org/OurWork/ST/NE/NEFW/WTS-Networks/IDN/idnfiles/Wkp_on_Development_WM,WasteCharacterization_Clearance/Day3/12.Statistics_GREY.pdf

Name: Systematic Uncertainty
Description: That component of uncertainty which arises from biases. www.iaea.org/OurWork/ST/NE/NEFW/WTS-Networks/IDN/idnfiles/Wkp_on_Development_WM,WasteCharacterization_Clearance/Day3/12.Statistics_GREY.pdf

Name: Taxanomic Loss Threshold
Description: Taxanomic Loss Threshold

Name: Upper Calibration Limit
Description: Upper Calibration Limit(UCL) - Highest concentration that can be reliably measured. The highest calibration standard in the lab's initial calibration curve adjusted for initial sample volume or weight

Name: Upper Quantitation Limit
Description: Upper Quantitation Limit - The largest concentration that an instrument can reliably detect.

Name: Upper Reporting Limit
Description: Upper Reporting Limit

Name: Water Quality Standard or Criteria
Description: Water Quality Standard or Criteria
